To get O Crit, you would need Improved Critical (already there), Power Attack, Cleave, and Great Cleave, and 23 STR. What is it that you are having a problem with when trying to use the CBC?  It will not account for gear or other environment-specific elements that may affect how the build is optimized, but it can serve as a launching point for those customizations.

All the CBC does is allow you to anticipate the potential of a build.  It won't help you play it.  It won't account for any "special" considerations, but it can lay out the sequence and potential at each level of progression.  Yes, its limited to 40 levels but that's because the legendary levels vary so much from server-to-server.  But the progression is all charted for you.  You can see, at a glimpse, the characteristics your toon has at each level and be able to plan accordingly. 

As Empyre has shown, there is a way to include all those special subrace adjustments when you design a new build.  It takes some experimenting to get it working, but if I can do it, I've got to feel anyone can.  If there are specific questions about using the CBC that baffle you (there are some conventions that may not be automatically intuititive), try posting in the General Forum.  It wuld be a good thread for people like you who might be struggling with the CBC a bit.  I'm sure between myself, Empyre and all those who use it a lot, you'll be able to make it an automatic extension of your build-designing process, regardless of the environment you plan to play it on.  If your computer can digest Excel you really have a leg up on the whole design process.  Not all of our members have MS Office.

I can't speak for the rest of the community, but the key to our expediting your requests is that you describe all the details that could impact the design process UP FRONT.  The CBC won't help us understand those elements.  Only YOU can divulge those.
